column5: I used to bring a case of beer up with me - but given that scotch is so expensive and selection so rare up North, have found that it's better to bring up a bottle and then pick up some Sleeman's Honey Brown once in Canada.

I like to light use a egg wash and plain bread crumbs on the walleye fillets As someone already stated, why cover up the flavor of good walleye. For the beer, we will do various IPA, Molson, Steamwhistle I do like some of the comments Free Yours Jim's Beer Cold
a free beer is always the best.

i 3rd rickards red....excellent in beer batter......white is good too.try adding a tablespoon of honey to the batter.....mmm mmm good! and for dry breading try panko if you havent....i like to mix 20% corn flour,20% miss vickys salt and vinegar chips and 60% panko,its excellent
123chadder, I am going to definitely try that. Thanks to everyone for the info.
Labatts in the batter and Labatts down my throat.

Jayme, I will definitely try that too. As a matter of fact I have many times. I am so fired up for Saturday. I am traveling from Wisconsin, heading up graham road, and ice out or no ice out, I am going to have a good time.
thats the spirit!
If I bring beer up, I will have Grain Belt Nordeast. But when in Cananda.....Molson XXX! I like the scotch idea others have mentioned. I might have to bring a bottle up this year.
Our favorite is "Blue". You must drink it very cold and in the summer this means fast so it does not loose its coldness. You just have to drink more, so plan accordinly.
1 Cold 2 Free 3 Your's And combination of the above is even better!
We have found that Blue works best in the beer batter,Hot peanut oil, Never had anyone turn it down during a meal. Never had a bad cold Beer?

Just thought of throwing this past you guys, and iam not a scientist.but you don't need beer in the batters all thats needed iscthe carbohydrates with is in most pop.we have always used 7 up or ginger ale works just as good, why waste a beer.lol.
Agreed

My annual trip group deep fries fish about one time every three years and on solo trips I never do. But with the lighter, more delicate pan fried or baked walleyes nothing beats a Shiner Bock (Spoetzl Brewery in Shiner, TX) or a Pacifico from Mexico.

Ya, don't care for a beer that dominates the flavor either, miller draft works as does Grain Belt premium or even Michelob draft. I'll drink LaBatts or Molson when in Canada for a change of pace, but tend to stay with milder beers normally. al

I think he's asking what brews do you like to drink when eating fresh walleye. If you're gravitating towards brown beer Sleeman makes a good Honey Brown Lager. They make a Porter too but I haven't tried that yet.
In that case the best beer is a scotch

My dad, brothers and I, used to boat into an outpost cabin - about a 27 mile trip. We have done this 15 - 20 times. One year, after shoving off from Ross' camp, we stopped at a resort down the lake on Clearwater, that had a store. My pick was Molson Black ice. Something like 8.5%. I drank 2 driving one of our boats out to camp. It was a 1.5 - 2 hour trip, depending on the weather. I had been up about 30 hours or so by this time. And, it was about 10am. Got to the camp - no problem. But when it came time to unload the boats, and carry everything up the hill to the cabin, my legs somehow became unconnected from my cerebral cortex. I learned a valuable lesson, all those years ago. NO drinking before noon. At least on the first and last day .......
A good scotch at the end of the day is hard to beat. I'm with there Zeebee.
Beer battered walleye with Kokanee,ice cold.Bill
I like my Labatts (regular preferred but unleaded works too) or some Moosehead.

I am new to this forum so bear with me if this has been discussed previously. Those walleye recipes are making me extremely excited for next weeks opener. So my question is, is what is your favorite beer to go with those fish. My favorite has always been LaBatts but lately I really have taken a liking to darker, amber type beer. Are there any local or Canadian darker beers that I might try. As a side note, I am really enjoying the discussions on here.
Always LaBatt's Blue - Leaded or unleaded work equally well. Just typing this made me thirsty Blair
For beer batter I prefer a full bodied brew,Rickers Red or Guiness,any amber or dark beer is much better than regular or light.Imho
Old Style
Ricards red tall boy
Cold.

For me the beer depends on the weather, colder calls for a darker beer, warmer, Blue has been a fav. Last August a new lake called for a new beer, Molson sure was a good warm weather beer! Just glad to have some good beer to go with fresh walleye!
I'm a Miller's High Life guy, but really my favorite is OPB (other peoples beer), especially my little Brothers, I like to think it brings us closer together!!!
Kokanee or Alexander Keith's IPA are excellent. Of course LaBatts Blue is also a really good beer. I do not like the Canadian light beers as much.
why kill the subtle flavor of walleye with a heavy batter
